caption:
Pregnancy is the most intense metabolic event the human body can handle.

You burn more energy than climbing any Everest —
2.2x your basal metabolic rate for 270 days straight.
The max human limit?
2.5x!!!

You’re basically living in ultra-marathon mode while growing a whole human.

And while you’re at it?
You grow a brand-new organ from scratch—the placenta.
It has more blood vessels than your lungs.
You rewire your brain, double your blood volume, and run two immune systems at once.
(And somehow still get sh*t done.)

And yet…
after all that,
the first thing people say is:
“Wow, you got big!”
Or:
“So when are you planning to bounce back?”

You just built lungs, kidneys, a heart—
and we’re still reducing women to their waistlines.
Even in our most powerful biological state,
we get judged on appearance! Or stretch marks or face acne.

Wouldn’t you be tired if you were creating life from scratch
while holding down a job and pretending everything’s fine?

Here’s the truth:
Most women go into pregnancy depleted, under-muscled, and overwhelmed.
No one teaches us to train for this.
But athletes do.

They fuel.
They prep.
They recover with intention.
And that’s exactly how we should be treating pregnancy too.

Because whether you’re pregnant, postpartum, or just navigating hormones like a boss—

You are an ultra-endurance athlete in disguise.

You deserve deep nourishment,
actual rest,
and way more respect than a “are you sure it’s not twins?”

please remember how important muscle is… I won’t whether you want me to share a little bit more about the journey!
